text: Introduction: Praise be to Allah, the Possessor of Power and Majesty, and of abundant blessings and favors, Who bestowed upon us His knowledge, guided us to acknowledge His divinity, and made us part of the nation of the Seal of Prophets, who is superior in merit over all worlds, of pure lineage, and noble character. To whom Allah the Generous addressed in the Wise Remembrance saying: {And indeed, you are of a great moral character} [Al-Qalam: 4]. And He said regarding His support for His religion: {It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah dislike it} [At-Tawbah: 33]. May Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and elevate his station with Him, and upon his brethren, his relatives, his chosen companions, his followers, and peace be upon him and them all until the Day of Judgment... To proceed, Allah has guided us through His Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and brought us out through him from darkness into light, and granted us the goodness of this world and the Hereafter through the blessing of his message and the prosperity of his ambassadorship. He held a supreme status with his Lord. In the Mighty Book of Allah, there are many verses articulating his beautiful mention, peace be upon him, enumerating his virtues, magnifying his affair, and highlighting his worth. Among that is His saying, Glory be to Him: {O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner (45) And one who invites to Allah, by His permission, and an illuminating lamp} [Al-Ahzab: 45-46]. Glory be to Him, He has gathered for him in this verse various ranks of preference and a sum of descriptions

text: of praise. He made him a witness over his nation by conveying the message to them, bearing it in this world and performing it in the Hereafter. The Almighty says: {That you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you} [Al-Baqarah: 143]. He is a bearer of glad tidings for those who obey him, a warner for those who disobey him, a caller to His oneness and worship, and an illuminating lamp by which light is sought in the darkness of ignorance and misguidance, and by whose lights one is guided to the paths of righteousness and guidance. His Lord described him with this verse in the Torah, with an addition: «A sanctuary for the illiterates (1), you are My servant and My Messenger, I have named you Al-Mutawakkil (The Reliant). He is not rude, nor harsh, nor loud (2) in the markets. He does not repel evil with evil, but he pardons and forgives. Allah will not take his soul until he straightens the crooked religion by them saying 'La ilaha illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah), opening thereby blind eyes, deaf ears, and wrapped hearts». Indeed, among his virtues with Allah is that He made obedience to him obedience to Allah, saying: {He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allah} [An-Nisa: 80]. And his Lord swore by the life of His Messenger, peace be upon him—and Glory be to Him, He may swear by whatever He wills of His creation, but that is not for any of them to do. Ibn Abbas says: «Allah did not create, nor originate, nor form a soul more honorable to Him than Muhammad, peace be upon him. I never heard Allah swear by the life of anyone other than him. The Almighty said: {By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their

Surah Ad-Dhuha contains five aspects of Allah's honoring of Muhammad, peace be upon him, highlighting his mention, and magnifying him: First: Swearing to him about what He informed him regarding his state in His saying: {By the morning brightness (1) And [by] the night when it covers with darkness} [Ad-Dhuha: 1-2], meaning: By the Lord of the morning brightness, and this is among the highest degrees of kindness... Second: Clarifying his status with Him and his favor in His sight by saying: {Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you]} [Ad-Dhuha: 3], meaning: He has not abandoned you nor hated you after He chose you and loved you... Third: {And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life]} [Ad-Dhuha: 4], meaning: Every later state of yours has superiority over the previous state. Thus, he, peace be upon him, continued to ascend in the degrees of loftiness, his religion was established for him, he was supported against his enemies, and he was guided in his affairs until he died. He reached a state of virtues, blessings, delight of the eye, and joy of the heart that neither the first nor the last have reached. Then after this, do not ask about his condition in the Hereafter regarding the details of honor and types of bounty, for indeed his Lord bestowed Al-Kawthar upon him... Fourth: {And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied} [Ad-Dhuha: 5]. This is a comprehensive verse for the aspects of dignity, types of happiness, and the confirmation of blessings in both abodes and more...

text: Fifth: His enumeration, Glory be to Him, of the aspects of His favor upon him, peace be upon him, saying: {Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge? (6) And He found you lost and guided [you]? (7) And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient?} [Ad-Dhuha: 6-8]. Glory be to Him, He praised his character saying: {And indeed, you are of a great moral character} [Al-Qalam: 4]. He praised his sight saying: {The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit]} [An-Najm: 17]. He praised his speech saying: {Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination (3) It is not but a revelation revealed} [An-Najm: 3-4]. He raised his mention so that He is not mentioned except that he (the Prophet) is mentioned with Him, as in the Adhan (call to prayer), the Tashahhud, sermons, gatherings, and festivals; that is His saying: {And We raised high for you your repute} [Ash-Sharh: 4]. He is the owner of Al-Wasila (1), Al-Fadila (2), the Praiseworthy Station (Al-Maqam Al-Mahmud) (3), the Visited Pond (Al-Hawd), and the Banner of Praise under which every praiser will be. He is the most honored of Allah's creation to Him, and the Master of the Children of Adam. All of this is but a drop in the ocean and a little of the abundance of his virtue, peace be upon him. Since Allah has obligated us to honor him, support him in every way {That you [people] may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor him and respect him} [Al-Fath: 9], to prefer him with our lives and wealth in every situation, and to guard and protect him from every harm—even though Allah has sufficed His Messenger from the support of

text: creation {If you do not aid the Prophet - Allah has already aided him} [At-Tawbah: 40], but [this is] so He may test some of you by means of others, and so Allah may make evident those who support Him and His Messenger unseen; so that the reward may be justified by deeds as written in the Mother of the Book—I loved to contribute my share in clarifying a small amount of the details regarding the obligation of loving him, the necessity of supporting him, the sincerity of counseling for him, and his right upon his nation, upon him be the best peace and blessings... And know—may Allah enlighten your heart and mine, and multiply my love and your love for this noble Prophet—that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, has great rights upon you, including: 1 - {So believe in Allah and His Messenger}. It is obligatory upon every believer to believe in him, peace be upon him, and to verify what he brought. This is the meaning of the testimony that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah: Obeying him in what he commanded, believing him in what he informed, avoiding what he forbade and prohibited, and that Allah is not worshipped except by what he prescribed... Sheikh Al-Islam says in Majmoo' Al-Fatawa: "It is obligatory upon creation to acknowledge what the Prophet, peace be upon him, brought. Whatever the Mighty Quran or the instructive Sunnah brought, it is obligatory upon creation to acknowledge it generally, and specifically when known in detail. A man is not a believer until he acknowledges what the Prophet, peace be upon him, brought. This is the realization of the testimony that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. Whoever testifies that he is the Messenger of Allah, testifies

text: that he is truthful in what he informs about Allah, for this is the reality of testifying to the Message." Ibn Al-Qayyim says in Madarij Al-Salikin: "The height of etiquette with the Messenger, peace be upon him, is complete submission to him, compliance with his command, and receiving his news with acceptance and belief, without opposing it with a false imagination called 'rationality', or bearing a doubt or suspicion against it, or prioritizing the opinions of men and the refuse of their minds over it. Thus, one singles him out for judgment, submission, compliance, and obedience, just as one singles out the Sender, Glory be to Him, for worship, humility, submissiveness, repentance, and reliance." The command to believe in the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, has been repeated, and indeed paired with belief in Allah. The Almighty says: {Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward (7) And why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should be believers?} [Al-Hadid: 7-8]. So the Lord made belief in His Messenger, peace be upon him, and what he invites to, a condition for belief in Him. How could it be otherwise when He supported him with clear signs indicating the truth of what he brought? Hence, following this verse came: {It is He who sends down upon His Servant verses of clear evidence} [Al-Hadid: 9]. And Glory be to Him, He said: {The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allah. It is those who are

text: the truthful} [Al-Hujurat: 15]. Ponder the restriction of faith using the restrictive particle {innama} (only) to those who believed in Allah and His Messenger, then did not doubt or waver, but remained firm on a single state which is pure belief. Then came the expenditure of wealth and self in the path of Allah. The reward was that He pointed to them with {ula'ika} (those), indicating the loftiness of their rank and reward, followed by the commendation {they are the truthful}, meaning those whose actions verified their words... Indeed, Allah judged with disbelief those who do not believe in His Messenger and warned them of His Blaze, saying: {And whoever has not believed in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze} [Al-Fath: 13]. Muslim (1) narrated from the hadith of Abu Huraira that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: «By the One in whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, no one from this nation, Jew or Christian, hears of me and then dies without believing in what I was sent with, except that he will be among the companions of the Fire»... He also narrated (2) that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: «I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and believe in what I have brought. If they do that, their blood and wealth are protected from me, except by its right, and their reckoning is with Allah».

text: Look at the lofty rank and great status attained by the Siddiq (Truthful One) of this Ummah, when he truly believed the Messenger of Allah and had true faith in him. Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: «When the Prophet was taken on the Night Journey to Al-Masjid Al-Aqsa, people began talking about it in the morning. Some people who had believed in him and affirmed him apostatized. They went with this news to Abu Bakr and said: 'Do you know what your companion is up to? He claims he was taken by night to Bayt Al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) last night.' He said: 'Or did he say that?' They said: 'Yes!' He said: 'If he said that, then he has spoken the truth.' They said: 'Do you believe that he went last night to Bayt Al-Maqdis and came back before morning?!' He said: 'Yes, I believe him in what is further than that; I believe him regarding the news of the heavens in the morning or evening.' Therefore, he was named Al-Siddiq». Narrated by Al-Hakim (1) and authenticated by Al-Albani (2). Among the subtleties of this chapter indicating the illustrious status of the two Sheikhs (Abu Bakr and Umar) is that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to his companions: «While a shepherd was with his sheep, a wolf attacked and took a sheep. He pursued it until he rescued it. The wolf turned to him and said: 'Who will protect it on the day of the beasts of prey, when it has no shepherd but me?!' And while a man was driving a cow that he had placed a load upon, it turned to him and spoke, saying: 'I was not created for this, but I was

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet, Peace Be Upon Him
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: created for plowing.' The people said: 'Glory be to Allah!' The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed, I believe in that, as do Abu Bakr and Umar bin Al-Khattab'». Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1)... And observe—may Allah have mercy on you—the extent of faith in the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, among the Companions and the degree of verification, in what Muslim narrated (2) from the hadith of Nawwas bin Sam'an in the story of the False Messiah (Al-Masih Ad-Dajjal), wherein it says: «He will emerge from a road between the Levant and Iraq, spreading corruption to the right and left. O servants of Allah, stand firm. We said: O Messenger of Allah, how long will he stay on earth? He said: Forty days; a day like a year, a day like a month, a day like a week, and the rest of his days like your days. We said: O Messenger of Allah, regarding that day which is like a year, will the prayers of one day suffice us in it? He said: No; estimate the time for it». Here he is, peace be upon him, informing them of the length of a day in the time of Dajjal such that it becomes like a year, yet his companions ask only about the prayer. This is due solely to the swiftness of their response and the firmness of their virtue—and no wonder, for they are those whom their Lord purified... And on the Day of the Confederates (Ahzab), when ranks were distinguished into three categories with no fourth: either a pure believer, a disbeliever declaring his disbelief, or a hypocrite revealing the wickedness of his inner self. On a day when the Muslims were afflicted with hunger, fear, and the gathering of

text: their enemies against them. While digging the trench, a solid white rock obstructed the Muslims, difficult for them to break. Salman, may Allah be pleased with him, went to inform the Messenger of Allah. He, peace be upon him—may my father and mother be his ransom—stood up for it. He took the pickaxe from Salman and struck the rock a blow that cracked it, and a flash of lightning emitted from it lighting up what was between the two lava fields (labatayn) of Medina as if it were a lamp in a dark night. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said 'Allahu Akbar' and his companions said 'Allahu Akbar'. He struck it a second time, and the same happened, then a third... They asked the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and he said: «When I struck the first time, the cities of Kisra (Persia) and their surroundings were raised for me until I saw them with my own eyes. Those of his companions who were present said: O Messenger of Allah, pray to Allah to open them for us, grant us their lands as spoils, and destroy their countries by our hands. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, prayed for that. Then I struck the second time, and the cities of Caesar (Rome) and their surroundings were raised for me until I saw them with my own eyes. They said: O Messenger of Allah, pray to Allah to open them for us, grant us their lands as spoils, and destroy their countries by our hands. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, prayed for that. Then I struck the third time, and the cities of Abyssinia and the villages around them were raised for me until I saw them with my own eyes. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said at that point: Leave the Abyssinians alone as long as they leave you alone». Narrated by An-Nasa'i and authenticated by Al-Albani (1)...

text: Lend your hearing and sight to what you read; see the spirit of hope and glad tidings spread by the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in a time of hunger where the Companions complained of hunger to the Messenger of Allah, lifting [their clothes to reveal] a stone [tied] on their bellies, so the Messenger of Allah lifted [his to reveal] two stones. In intense fear, yet the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, believed what he told them in this critical time without doubt, for his judgment is just and his news is truth. Therefore, Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, used to say when these lands were conquered: "Conquer whatever seems good to you, for by the One in whose hand is the soul of Abu Huraira, you have not conquered a city, nor will you conquer one until the Day of Judgment, except that Allah had given Muhammad, peace be upon him, its keys before that."... From what has passed, you must hasten to believe in the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. Beware of directing suspicion towards Prophetic Hadiths, and do not make your heart like a sponge absorbing whatever comes to it. Avoid raising doubts or presenting them to yourself or others, for doubts snatch away, hearts are weak, and most who cast them are carriers of firewood—the innovators and their followers. So beware of them, and you have a role model in your righteous predecessors, so follow their guidance...

text: 2 - So That Allah Loves You... A group of people during the time of the Messenger of Allah claimed they loved Allah, so the Verse of Examination was revealed: {Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful." (31) Say, "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not love the disbelievers} [Al-Imran: 31-32]. Ibn Kathir says: «This verse is the judge over everyone who claims to love Allah but is not on the Muhammadan path; for he is a liar in his claim in reality until he follows the Muhammadan law and the Muhammadan religion in all his sayings and deeds» (1). Ibn Al-Qayyim said: «'Allah will love you' is a pointer to the proof of love, its fruit, and its benefit, which is the love of the Sender for you. So unless following occurs, your love for Him is not achieved, and His love for you is negated» (2). Thus, the love of Allah is established by following the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in his deeds, sayings, and character... Reflect—may Allah grant you success—on the fruit of following the Messenger of Allah: Allah's love and the forgiveness of sins. And beware of abandoning his obedience {But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not love the disbelievers}.

text: "You disobey the God while claiming His love... This, by my life, is a strange logic. / If your love were true, you would have obeyed Him... For indeed, the lover is obedient to whom he loves." Imam Ahmad—may Allah have mercy on him—says: «I looked in the Mushaf (Quran) and found obedience to the Messenger, peace be upon him, in thirty-three places» (1). Sheikh Al-Islam says: «Allah commanded obedience to His Messenger, peace be upon him, in more than thirty places in the Quran. He paired obedience to him with obedience to Himself, and paired opposing him with opposing Himself, just as He paired his name with His name, so He is not mentioned except that he (the Prophet) is mentioned with Him.» Obedience to Allah and His Messenger, peace be upon him, is mercy {And obey Allah and the Messenger that you may receive mercy} [Al-Imran: 132]... Obedience to Allah and His Messenger, peace be upon him, is success {And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers} [An-Nur: 52], {And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment} [Al-Ahzab: 71]...

text: And obedience to Allah and His Messenger, peace be upon him, is the cause for entering Paradise {And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment} [An-Nisa: 13]... Indeed, obedience to Allah and His Messenger is a great cause for joining those of high ranks {And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions} [An-Nisa: 69]... And beware—may Allah guide you—of opposing Allah and His Messenger, for opposition is the cause of misery in this world and the Hereafter. The Almighty says: {And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way. (27) Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend} [Al-Furqan: 27-28]. This verse clarifies the state of the one who opposes the Messenger, peace be upon him, when people stand before the Lord of the Worlds; the wrongdoer bites on his hands in sorrow and regret for opposing the Messenger, peace be upon him, but how will the remembrance help him then..?! And Glory be to Him says: {The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger." (66) And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries, and they led us astray from the [right] way. (67) Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse."} [Al-Ahzab: 66-68].

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: Compare between the state of the follower and the opposer or innovator: the followers are in Gardens, successful, guided, receiving mercy; while the opposers, sorrow has reached its peak with them, biting their fingertips in regret, and they are marched into Hell in groups, cursing one another and praying against one another. Among the verses most indicative of the obligation of submitting to his judgment, peace be upon him, and complying with him is His saying: {But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission} [An-Nisa: 65]. In this verse, Glory be to Him, He swore by the greatest object of oath—Himself, Mighty and Majestic—that faith is not established for them, nor are they among its people, until they make the Messenger of Allah judge in all matters of dispute and in all chapters of religion, for the term 'ma' (that over which) is a form of generality. The command was not limited to mere arbitration, but He added to it the openness of their chests to his judgment, such that they find within themselves no discomfort—tightness—from his judgment. Rather, they accept his judgment with openness and meet it with submission, not taking it grudgingly or swallowing it with difficulty, for that is contrary to faith. Then, Glory be to Him, He did not stop at that until He added His saying: {and submit in [full, willing] submission}. He mentioned the verb emphasized by its infinitive (masdar) based on repeating its mention, which is submission, humility, and compliance willingly and contentedly, submitting not out of coercion or endurance as the conquered submits to the conqueror against his will. Rather, it is the submission of an obedient servant to his master and lord

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: who is the most beloved thing to him, knowing that his happiness and salvation lie in submitting to him, and knowing that he is more worthy of him than himself, kinder to him than it, and more capable of saving it, as the Almighty said: {The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves} [Al-Ahzab: 6]. Whenever a servant wants to know his acceptance of the judgment of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and his submission to it, let him look at his state and examine his heart when his judgment arrives contrary to his desire and purpose, or contrary to what he imitated his ancestors in regarding major and minor issues {Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness} [Al-Qiyamah: 14]. So Glory be to Allah! How much resentment is in the souls of many people regarding many texts; they wish they had not been revealed!! How much heat is in their livers from them!! And how much choking is in their throats from them and their source!! Those secrets will appear to them on the Day when secrets are tested, blackening and disgracing faces {It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error} [Al-Ahzab: 36]. Al-Bukhari (1) narrated from the hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: «All of my followers will enter Paradise except those who refuse. They said: O Messenger of Allah, who would refuse? He said: Whoever obeys me enters Paradise, and whoever disobeys me has

text: refused». And he also narrated from the hadith of Jabir who said: «Angels came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, while he was sleeping. Some of them said, 'He is sleeping.' Others said, 'The eye sleeps, but the heart is awake.' They said, 'Your companion has a parable.' They said, 'His parable is like that of a man who built a house, arranged a banquet in it, and sent a caller. Whoever answers the caller enters the house and eats from the banquet, and whoever does not answer the caller does not enter the house and does not eat from the banquet.' They said, 'Interpret it for him so he understands it.' Some of them said, 'The house is Paradise, and the caller is Muhammad, peace be upon him. Whoever obeys Muhammad, peace be upon him, has obeyed Allah, and whoever disobeys Muhammad has disobeyed Allah. And Muhammad is the separator between people.'» In the hadith of Al-Irbad bin Sariyah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: «The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, gave us a sermon by which our hearts trembled and our eyes shed tears. We said: O Messenger of Allah, it is as if this is a farewell sermon, so advise us. He said: 'I advise you to fear Allah and to hear and obey, even if a slave is appointed as a leader over you. Imam Al-Khattabi says: - "He only intended by that the seriousness in adhering to the Sunnah, like the action of one who holds onto something between his molars and bites down on it to prevent it from being snatched away. That is the strongest grasp on a thing, as holding it with the front teeth is easier to take and easier to pull away." The hadith contains two fundamental pillars: 1/ Following (Ittiba')... 2/ And condemning innovation (Ibtida')... Everything that the Messenger, peace be upon him, left regarding acts of worship, and did not do despite the existence of a reason to do it during his time, peace be upon him, then doing it is an innovation (bid'ah), and leaving it is a sunnah. Such as celebrating the Mawlid (Birthday), celebrating the Night of Isra and Mi'raj, celebrating the Night of Hijrah, the New Year, etc., due to the saying of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: «Whoever performs a deed that is not in accordance with our matter, it is rejected». Ibn Masud said: «Follow and do not innovate, for you have been sufficed» (2).

Al-Bukhari (3) narrated from Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, who said: «When the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, arrived in Medina, he prayed towards Bayt Al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) for sixteen or seventeen months, but he loved that he be directed towards the Kaaba. So Allah Almighty revealed: {We have certainly seen the turning of your face, [O Muhammad], toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased} [Al-Baqarah: 144]. So he turned towards the Kaaba. A man prayed Asr with him, then went out and passed by some people of the Ansar, and said: 'He testifies that he prayed with the Prophet, peace be upon him, and that he has been directed towards the Kaaba'. So they turned while they were bowing in the Asr prayer...» How swift was their emulation! They did not hesitate to hold onto what he brought; rather, they did not even wait to lift their heads from bowing, but hastened to turn towards where the

After that, they never camped at a place except that they joined together» such that it was said: «If a cloth were spread over them, it would cover them all»... Reflect—may Allah help you obey Him—on the tone of the affectionate mother, shading with abundant emotion and love, asking permission from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, to add extensions to her daughter's hair who is recovering from illness and is a new bride. The overwhelming feelings stirring in that mother's heart, and the unbridled desire to beautify her little daughter and realize her joy, did not justify committing the forbidden for her... She did not feel comfortable adding extensions under the pretext of ignorance of the ruling, or the bride's need for it. Rather, she came seeking a fatwa from the Messenger of Allah, satisfied with his judgment, submitting to his command... How much we need in this age, where the love of pleasures and satisfying desires with prohibitions has become widespread, to subdue ourselves to what pleases our Lord Almighty, and by making our desires follow the Sunnah of our Prophet, peace be upon him, so that we love what he loves and leave what he hates, following our righteous predecessors in that... And let no one think that compliance was a trait of individuals of that bright era only; rather, it was the characteristic of all its members. Abu Dawood narrated and Al-Albani authenticated

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: (1) from the hadith of Abu Usaid Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, while he was coming out of the mosque, and men had mixed with women in the road. He said: «Wait behind, for it is not for you to take the middle of the road; you should take the edges of the road.» So women would stick to the wall until their garments would catch on the wall due to their closeness to it... Ibrahim bin Mujamma' said: «We used to seek help in memorizing hadith by acting upon it». Ahmad bin Hanbal said: «I never wrote a hadith except that I acted upon it, until it passed by me that the Prophet, peace be upon him, «got cupped and gave Abu Shaybah a dinar,» so I got cupped and gave the cupper a dinar» (2). So exert your effort in preserving knowledge—a preservation of care through knowledge and following, not just by doing obligations and leaving prohibitions, but by being eager to do the Sunnah acts and leave the disliked acts, and distinguish yourself in your general affairs by using the traditions (Athar) of

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: the Messenger of Allah as much as possible. Impose the Sunnahs upon yourself, for Allah Almighty says: {There has certainly been for you in the Messenger of Allah an excellent pattern} [Al-Ahzab: 21]. Buy yourself today while the market is established, the price exists, and the goods are cheap. A day will come upon that market and goods when you will not be able to obtain little or much; that is the Day of Deprivation (At-Taghabun), the Day the wrongdoer bites on his hands... 3 - Even More Than Yourself... Know—may Allah grant you success—that loving the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, is part of faith; indeed, it takes precedence over loving oneself, as Al-Bukhari narrated (1) from the hadith of Abdullah bin Hisham, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: We were with the Prophet, peace be upon him, and he was holding the hand of Umar, may Allah be pleased with him. Umar said to him: O Messenger of Allah, you are more beloved to me than everything except myself. The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: «No, by the One in whose Hand is my soul, until I am more beloved to you than yourself». Umar said to him: «Indeed, now, by Allah!! You are more beloved to me than myself». He said: «Now, O Umar». What is noted in his saying «By the One in whose Hand is my soul» is that he did not swear [lightly] while he is the Truthful and Trusted One; the oath is for emphasis. And his saying «Now, O Umar» means: completed

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: is your faith (1)... The confirmation of this hadith is His saying Almighty: {The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves} [Al-Ahzab: 6]. And it takes precedence over the love of parent and child, as Al-Bukhari narrated (2) from the hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: «By the One in whose Hand is my soul, none of you believes until I am more beloved to him than his parent and his child». Indeed, his love must be prioritized over family, wealth, and all people. Muslim narrated (3) from the hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: «None of you believes until I am more beloved to him than his family, his wealth, and all people». Whoever reflects on the preceding hadiths finds types of love: love is either love of reverence and magnification like loving a parent; or love of affection and tenderness like loving a child; or love for kindness and qualities of perfection like people loving one another; or love of need/wealth like loving money; or love of survival like loving oneself. A servant does not believe until the love of the Messenger, peace be upon him, is stronger to him than all these loves,

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: Allah Almighty has threatened those for whom anything of creation is more beloved than Allah and His Messenger, saying: {Say, [O Muhammad], "If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people."} [At-Tawbah: 24]. Mujahid and Al-Hasan (1)—may Allah have mercy on them—say in interpreting His saying {then wait until Allah executes His command}: «With a punishment, later or sooner. Then Allah labeled them disobedient (Fasiqeen) at the end of the verse, and informed them that they are more astray than one who has erred and Allah has not guided him». Al-Zamakhshari (2) says: - «This is a severe verse; I do not see one more severe than it». Al-Qurtubi (3) says: - «In the verse is proof of the obligation of loving Allah and His Messenger, and there is no disagreement on that, and that this takes precedence over every beloved object». You will not find the sweetness of faith—which means finding pleasure in acts of obedience, bearing hardships in religion, and preferring that over worldly goods, which signifies the soundness

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: of your heart and your health—until the love of Allah and His Messenger is complete. You should not satisfy yourself with the root of love, but rather Allah and His Messenger must be more beloved to you than anything else. And with the branch of love, that a person loves only for the sake of Allah. And one must repel its opposite by hating to return to disbelief or disobedience after Allah has guided him. The Two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim) (1) narrated from the hadith of Anas regarding the Prophet: «There are three qualities, whoever has them will find the sweetness of faith: that Allah and His Messenger are more beloved to him than anything else; that he loves a person and does not love him except for the sake of Allah; and that he hates to return to disbelief just as he hates to be thrown into the Fire». Rejoice, O lover, in accompanying whom you loved. Muslim (2) narrated from the hadith of Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: «A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said: O Messenger of Allah, when is the Hour? He said: 'What have you prepared for the Hour?' He said: Love for Allah and His Messenger. He said: 'Indeed, you are with whom you loved.'» Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, said: We did not rejoice after Islam over anything more than the Prophet's saying, peace be upon him: «Indeed, you are with whom you loved». Anas said: «So I love Allah, His Messenger, Abu Bakr, and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, and I hope to Allah that I will be with them, and to act according to their deeds».

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: Loving Allah and His Messenger is of two degrees: Obligatory love, which is the degree of the economical (Al-Muqtasideen), requiring that Allah and His Messenger be more beloved to him than anything else, such that he does not hate anything He hates, but loves everything Allah and His Messenger obligated, and hates what Allah and His Messenger forbade. Allah Almighty says: {That is because they followed what angered Allah and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds} [Muhammad: 28]. As for Recommended love, which is the degree of the foremost (Al-Sabiqeen), it is by loving what Allah loves of voluntary deeds and virtues with a complete love. This is the state of those brought near (Al-Muqarrabeen) whom Allah has drawn close to Him—may Allah make me and you among them (1)... People are divided regarding the love of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, into three sections: - People of excess, people of negligence, and a middle path between them. Thus Allah made the nation of Muhammad a middle nation... As for the first of them, they are those who innovated matters that Allah and His Messenger did not prescribe, thinking that doing these things is the sign and proof of love. They forgot His saying: {So follow me, [so] Allah will love you}. So they celebrated his birthday (Mawlid)—and if it were

About that, one of them says: "O most noble of creation, I have no one to seek refuge with... But you, upon the occurrence of the general calamity. If you do not take my hand in the Hereafter... Out of kindness, then say, 'O slip of the foot'" (1). They busied themselves with memorizing prophetic eulogies instead of preserving his Sunnah, so the people [of Truth] walked while they stopped, and the people arrived while they were cut off. The situation reached the point with some of them that they started invoking the Messenger of Allah instead of Allah, swearing by him, and wiping themselves on the chamber containing his grave, along with other acts of Shirk done under the claim of loving the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, while they are contrary to it and far from it... As for the negligent one, he is the one who did not observe the right of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, regarding the obligation of prioritizing his love over the love of self, family, and wealth... He did not honor him, revere him, obey his command, or follow his Sunnah. That is only due to his sin, drowning in the desires of his self, and prioritizing his whims over what came in the law of his Lord. Then he believed the ignorance of

How many of these are there—may Allah not increase them—in this time... As for the third section, whom Allah has guided, they are those who took the middle path between the two extremes. The people of this section are the Salaf from the Companions and Tabi'in and those who walked on their path until the Day of Judgment. They loved the Prophet, peace be upon him, above the love of self, child, family, and all creation. They followed him, honored him, supported him, preserved his Sunnah in care and narration. They believed that exaggeration in his right, status, and describing him with things Allah reserved for Himself alone is not part of love at all; rather, they knew this is opposition and contradiction to that love {So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment} [An-Nur: 63]... Among the signs of this love: Eagerness to see him, frequent mention of him by sending blessings and peace upon him, adhering to his obedience, preserving and supporting his Sunnah, defending his honor, loving whom he loved, and hating whom he hated. Some of this has passed, and the rest will come with some mention, God willing...

text: The Righteous Salaf have the most fragrant mention regarding the love of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. Here are some of the biographies of the people regarding sincerity of love and great emotion: Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, was asked: How was your love for the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him? He said: By Allah, he was more beloved to us than our wealth, our children, our fathers, our mothers, and than cold water upon thirst (1)... Abu Sufyan bin Harb—while he was still a polytheist then—asked Zaid bin Al-Dathinah, may Allah be pleased with him, when the people of Mecca took him out of the Sanctuary to kill him: "I ask you by Allah, O Zaid, would you love that Muhammad was now in your place for us to strike his neck, and that you were with your family?" He said: "By Allah, I would not love that Muhammad is in his place where he is now, being pricked by a thorn that hurts him, while I am sitting with my family." Abu Sufyan said: "I have not seen anyone among people love someone like the companions of Muhammad love Muhammad" (2)... A man from the Ansar came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said: "You are more beloved to me than myself, my child, my family, and my wealth. If it were not that I come to you and see you, I would think

text: Listen to the words of Qais bin Sirma Al-Ansari as he says when the Prophet, peace be upon him, arrived in Medina: "He stayed among Quraysh for ten odd years... Reminding, hoping to meet a favorable friend / And offering himself to the people of the seasons... But he saw no one to shelter him and saw no caller / But when he came to us and the destination settled him... And he became happy with Taybah (Madinah), satisfied / We spent for him the wealth from our lawful money... And our souls during war, and consolation / We ransom against whoever shows hostility from all people... Together, even if [the enemy] was the sincere beloved / And we know that there is no Lord but Allah... And that the Messenger of Allah has become a guide." Have you seen a love greater than the love of Muhammad's companions, peace be upon him, for him? After what has passed; remember how many times you prioritized the love of yourself, your father, your child, and your spouse over the love of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. How many times have you obeyed them and disobeyed him, and made them judge

How do you exchange what is lower for what is better, while reading {And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way"}? Know that if you please Allah, He will make all people pleased with you even if they were angry; and if you seek their pleasure through Allah's anger, Allah will be angry with you and will make people angry with you even if they were pleased. So tighten your standard, and make it the pleasure of your Lord; you will win by the permission of your Master. May you be blessed, and may your work be blessed. 4 - Have you longed for him?! Have you wished for his companionship?! There is no doubt that the ultimate goal of a lover is to see his beloved, to enjoy his companionship, and to brighten his eye with his vision, even if this vision cost wealth and family. Our Messenger, peace be upon him, stated this sign in what Muslim (1) narrated from the hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: «Among the people of my nation who love me most are people who will come after me; one of them would wish if he could see me [even if it cost him] his family and wealth»... The Messenger, peace be upon him, described the people of this sign from the Ummah as being among the people who love the Messenger of Allah most. None appreciates the right of this wish except

One of them would not mind spending his family and wealth to have the honor of seeing him, peace be upon him. The tongue of such a person's state says: How great is the wish, and how cheap is the price... Such souls are worthy of obtaining the testimony of the Prophet, peace be upon him, that they are the hearts most loving of him. Do not wonder at one who longs to see the one whom Allah chose, and by whom Allah guided him; the one who possessed qualities of perfection inherent in his creation, and encompassed the dispersed beauties without dispute among those who transmitted the news of that. He was not excessively tall nor short; not pure white (al-amhaq) (1) nor dark; not curly-haired (al-qatat) nor straight-haired (al-sabt) (2); medium built; broad between the shoulders; thick (shathan) (3) palms and feet; large head; large joints (karadis) (4); long chest-hair line (masrubah) (5); luminous/blooming color; wide forehead; arched (azajj) (6) eyebrows, long,

When he laughed, he laughed revealing teeth like hailstones or the brightness of lightning (sana). When he spoke, it was seen like light coming out from between his front teeth... Abu Huraira said: I never saw anything more beautiful than the Messenger of Allah; it was as if the sun was running in his face. If he laughed, it glittered on the walls... text: Ali said: Whoever saw him suddenly was awed by him, and whoever mixed with him with knowledge loved him. His describer says: I did not see before him nor after him anyone like him, peace be upon him (1)... This was regarding his physical creation. As for his character, it was the Quran, and his Lord praised him saying: {And indeed, you are of a great moral character}. After this physical and moral perfection, do you not long for him, and even sacrifice family and wealth to see him? Our righteous predecessors—may Allah be pleased with them—had great longing to meet him and eagerness for his companionship. Here are situations immortalized by history and preserved by biographies: Al-Bukhari (2) narrated from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: «While we were sitting in Abu Bakr's house in the noonday heat, someone said to Abu Bakr: 'This is the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, with his head covered (3)—at an hour he was not used to coming to us.' Abu Bakr said: 'May my father and mother be his ransom, by Allah, nothing brought him at this hour except a [serious] matter.' She said: He came and asked permission, so it was granted. He entered and the Prophet, peace be upon him, said to Abu Bakr: 'Let those who are with you leave.' Abu Bakr said: 'They are only your family, may my father be your ransom, O Messenger

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: of Allah.' He said: 'I have been given permission to leave [migrate].' Abu Bakr said: 'Companionship, may my father be your ransom, O Messenger of Allah?' The Messenger of Allah said: 'Yes'.» Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, did not think of the fears and dangers of travel, but was enamored by the honor of his companionship even if he left his family and wealth. When the glad tiding came, his tear rolled down onto his noble beard out of joy for the triumph and delight for the success. Al-Hafiz [Ibn Hajar] says: Ishaq added in his narration: «Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: So I saw Abu Bakr weeping, and I never calculated that anyone cries from joy» (1). The Ansar awaited the arrival of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, to Medina after his exit from Mecca. Al-Bukhari (2) narrated from the hadith of Urwa who said: «The Muslims in Medina heard of the exit of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, from Mecca. They used to go out every morning to Al-Harrah (lava field) and wait for him until the midday heat turned them back». In the narration of Ibn Sa'd (3): «When the sun burned them, they returned to their homes».

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet, Peace Be Upon Him
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: Imam Ahmad (1) tells us in the hadith of Anas that the number of those who received the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was about five hundred of the Ansar. They ended up at the Messenger of Allah and Abu Bakr, saying: «Proceed, safe and obeyed». As for the people of Medina, listen to Al-Siddiq telling you about their reception of the best guest to descend upon them: "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, proceeded and I was with him until we arrived in Medina. People met him; they came out on the road and on the rooftops (ajajeer) (2). The servants and children rushed in the road saying: 'Allahu Akbar! The Messenger of Allah has come! Muhammad, peace be upon him, has come!' He said: And the people disputed over whom he would stay with... There is no doubt that a student of knowledge, after finishing the memorization of the Book of Allah, must be keen on memorizing the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, as it is the foundation of the Sharia and its base. Allah Almighty says: {And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from} [Al-Hashr: 7] and He says: {Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination} [An-Najm: 3]. Al-Bukhari, may Allah have mercy on him, says: 'The best of Muslims is a man who revives a Sunnah from the Sunan of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that has died out. So be patient, O people of Sunan, may Allah have mercy on you, for you are the fewest of people.' Al-Baghdadi said: 'Al-Bukhari's saying: "The people of Sunan are the fewest of people," he meant by it the Huffaz (memorizers) of Hadith, who know its paths, and distinguish its authentic from its weak. He spoke the truth, may Allah have mercy on him. For if you consider it, you will not find a town from the towns of Islam devoid of a jurist or student of jurisprudence to whom the people of his region refer and rely upon in their fatwas, but you will find many regions empty of a man of Hadith...

text: Al-Hafiz Ibn Hajar read 'Al-Mu'jam Al-Saghir' of Al-Tabarani during his journey to the Levant in one sitting between the Dhuhr and Asr prayers, and this book contains about one thousand five hundred Hadiths... So draw—may Allah help you—a methodology for yourself in seeking Hadith and its sciences. For if you master this art, you will find its benefit in your worldly life and Hereafter when you are sincere in seeking it, and you will surpass your peers. In the Imam of Ahl al-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah, and the Imam of Muhaddithin, the author of the book which is the most authentic of books after the Book of Allah, Al-Bukhari, you have a predecessor (Salaf), so will you be the best successor (Khalaf)??! Start with 'Al-Arba'in' (The Forty) by Al-Nawawi, then 'Umdat al-Ahkam' by Al-Maqdisi, then 'Bulugh al-Maram' by Ibn Hajar, and 'Al-Muntaqa' by Al-Majd Ibn Taymiyyah—may Allah Almighty have mercy on them. Then enter into reading the Six Mother Books and others, with attention to the commentaries of each book. If you desire the chapters of etiquette, read 'Al-Adab Al-Mufrad' by Al-Bukhari. If you seek Seerah (biography) and knowledge of Maghazi (campaigns), then 'Mukhtasar Al-Sirah Al-Nabawiyyah' by Sheikh Muhammad bin Abd al-Wahhab, or 'Al-Raheeq Al-Makhtum' by Al-Mubarakpuri, for its author did well and benefited others. A Roman man came and said: 'Shall we not make something for you to sit on, appearing as if you are standing?' So he made a pulpit (Minbar) for him with two steps, and he would sit on the third. When the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, sat on the pulpit, the trunk mooed like the mooing of a bull until the mosque shook with its mooing out of sadness for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, descended from the pulpit and embraced it while it was mooing. When he embraced it, it became silent. Then he said: 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, had I not embraced it, it would have remained like this until the Hour was established,' out of sadness for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. So he ordered regarding it...

7 - (And Revere Him): Allah Almighty says: {That you [people] may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor him and revere him} [Al-Fath: 9]. The verse contains three rights for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: Belief in him, which has passed; honoring/supporting him (Ta'zeer), which will come; and here is the meaning of revering him (Tawqir). Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah says: 'Tawqir: A comprehensive name for everything that implies tranquility and calmness of respect and honor, and that he be treated with such nobility, honor, and magnification that protects him from anything that removes him from the boundary of dignity' (3). So Tawqir means magnification, respect, and aggrandizement (4). It is known that the rights of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, are more majestic, greater, nobler, and more binding...

It is obligatory upon us to love him and revere him more than the reverence of every slave for his master and every child for his father. The Holy Quran spoke with the likes of this. Allah Almighty says: {Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another} [An-Nur: 63]. Sheikh al-Islam says: 'Allah singled out His Prophet in this verse with an address befitting him, prohibiting them from saying: O Muhammad, or O Ahmad... but rather they should say: O Messenger of Allah. How could they address him thus, when Allah Glory be to Him honored him in His address to him with what He did not honor anyone else among the Prophets? He never called him by his name in the Quran ever. Rather He says: {O Prophet, say to your wives...}, {O Prophet, fear Allah...}. While He Glory be to Him said: {And We said, O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise...}, and said: {O Noah, indeed he is not of your family...}, and said: {O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you...}. However, if we are in the position of informing about him, we say: "I testify that there is no god but Allah, and I testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah." So we inform about him by his name as Allah Glory be to Him informed about him saying: {Muhammad is not the father of [any] one of your men}, and said: {Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah and those with him}...

text: ...so the difference between the station of address and information is a difference established by Sharia and reason (1). Read Surah Al-Hujurat and you will see the obligation of observing Prophetic etiquette with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. Allah Almighty says: {O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allah and His Messenger but fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing (1) O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not (2) Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah - they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward (3) Indeed, those who call you from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason (4) And if they had been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is Forgiving and Merciful}. The first etiquette: Prohibition of advancing before him with speech until he gives permission. For this reason, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to ask the Companions about the day they were in, and the place they were in, while they knew it perfectly well, yet they refrained from answering except by saying: 'Allah and His Messenger know best,' fearing that their speech might be advancing before Allah and His Messenger. The Hadith of the Sermon of Sacrifice in the Farewell Pilgrimage is the greatest witness to this. Second: He prohibited raising the voice above the voice of the Prophet, and speaking loudly to him...

Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, heard the voices of two men in the Mosque of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, which had become loud. He came and said: 'Do you know where you are?' Then he said: 'Where are you from?' They said: 'From the people of Ta'if.' He said: 'Had you been from the people of Medina, I would have beaten you painfully' (2). The scholars said: Raising one's voice at his grave is disliked just as it was disliked during his life, peace and blessings be upon him; for he is respected alive and dead. He warned them that if they did that {your deeds become worthless while you perceive not}. Abdul Rahman bin Mahdi, when he read the Hadith of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, would order them to be silent and say: 'Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet,' interpreting that listening to his Hadith when read requires the same silence as hearing his speech (3). So beware of raising your voice when his Hadith is conveyed, or in his Mosque, or mentioning him like mentioning ordinary people. Surah Al-Hujurat came with its miraculous style to magnify the status of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and show the loftiness of his high rank and the elevation of his station, peace and blessings be upon him...

Among the greatness of the status of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, is that Allah warned against harming him with the severest warning, saying: {Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment (57) And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned have certainly born upon themselves a slander and manifest sin} [Al-Ahzab]. Look how Allah paired harming His Messenger with harming Himself. Whoever harms him has harmed Allah, and whoever harms Allah has disbelieved. Reflect on His differentiation, Glory be to Him, between harming Allah and His Messenger and harming the believers; He assigned slander and manifest sin to the latter, while assigning the curse in this world and the Hereafter and humiliating punishment to the former. It is known that harming believers is a major sin, and nothing is above that except Kufr (disbelief). Furthermore, insulting the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, involves several rights: 1. Do not wonder at the state of the Companions of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, for he was the most merciful of creation and most compassionate to them, the most beneficial to them, the most eloquent of Allah's creation, the best of them in expressing many meanings with concise words, the most patient in places of patience, the most truthful in places of encounter, the most faithful to covenants and protection, the greatest in rewarding a favor with multiples of it, the most humble, the greatest in preferring others over himself, the strongest of creation in defending his companions, protecting them, and advocating for them. Whoever saw him unexpectedly revered him, and whoever mixed with him knowingly loved him. Allah singled him out with two qualities He singled out for the people of truthfulness and sincerity: Majesty and Love. So everyone who saw him revered and honored him, filling his heart with magnificence and majesty even if he was an enemy. If he mixed with him and lived with him, he became more beloved to him than any creature. He is the magnified revered one, the honored beloved one. This is the utmost perfection of love: that it be combined with magnification and awe (1).

text: Muhammad bin Sirin used to talk and laugh, but when the Hadith came, he became humble (1). Malik was asked about Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani, and he said: 'I have not narrated to you from anyone except that Ayyub is more trustworthy than him.' Malik said: 'He performed Hajj twice, and I used to observe him and did not hear from him, except that when the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was mentioned, he wept until I felt pity for him. When I saw from him what I saw and his reverence for the Prophet, I wrote from him.' Mus'ab bin Abdullah said: 'When the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was mentioned, Malik's color would change and he would stoop until it became difficult for those sitting with him. He was asked one day about that, and he said: If you saw what I saw, you would not reject what you see from me' (2). Abdul Rahman bin Al-Qasim used to mention the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and one would look at his color as if blood had been drained from him, and his tongue had dried in his mouth, out of awe for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. He used to come to Amir bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubair, and if the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was mentioned in his presence, he would weep until no tear remained in his eyes. 'Weeping drained the tears of your eye, so borrow... An eye from another whose tears are abundant.'

From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: 'The family of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, had a wild beast. When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, went out, it would play and run back and forth. But when it sensed the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, it would enter its resting place (Rabada) and not make a sound as long as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was in the house, disliking to annoy him.' Narrated by Ahmad (2) and Ibn Kathir authenticated its chain (3). text: Where is the reverence of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in the hearts of creation, by sensing his awe, peace and blessings be upon him, the majesty of his worth, the greatness of his status, and bringing to mind his virtues and the meanings that bring about his love and veneration? And everything that would make the heart a reminder of his right to reverence and support, acknowledging him and obeying him? For the heart is the king of the limbs, and they are its soldiers and followers. So whenever the magnification of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, is settled in the heart, inscribed in it through changing conditions, its effects will inevitably appear on the limbs. Then you will find the tongue flowing with his praise and commendation with what he is worthy of, from what his Lord praised him with and what he praised himself with, without exaggeration (Ghaluw) or negligence (Taqsir). Among the greatest praise, peace and blessings be upon him, is the prayer (Salah) upon him. For our prayer upon him implies the praise of the one praying and an indication of mentioning his honor and virtue, and a will from Allah Almighty to elevate his mention (1). From the magnification of the tongue is that we observe etiquette by mentioning him with our tongues, by coupling the mention of his name with the title of Prophethood or Messengership, along with sending prayers and peace upon him. From the magnification of the tongue is memorizing his Sunnah, conveying it, and calling to it. As for the magnification of the limbs, it is acting upon his Sharia, emulating his Sunnah, adopting his commands outwardly and inwardly, judging by what he brought in all matters, being pleased with his judgment and submitting to it, loving and hating for his sake, and striving against those who oppose him...

So reflect on your state, and stick to the guidance of your Prophet, for in holding to it is salvation, and in leaving it is destruction. text: Where is the reverence of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when the meanings of Prophetic Hadiths are played with under the pretext of reading the text more than one reading, and expanding the concepts of texts by an ignorant person who does not possess the tools of Ijtihad, let alone its conditions... ?!!! Ibn al-Qayyim - may Allah have mercy on him - says: 'And from etiquette with him is that his saying should not be deemed problematic, rather opinions should be deemed problematic because of his saying. His text should not be opposed by analogy (Qiyas), rather analogies should be discarded and his texts accepted. His speech should not be distorted from its reality for a fantasy that its people call "Reasonable" (Ma'qul). Yes! It is unknown (Majhul), and isolated from the truth. Accepting what he brought should not be suspended upon the agreement of anyone. All of this is from lack of etiquette with him, peace and blessings be upon him; rather it is the essence of audacity (1)... Leave every saying for the saying of Muhammad... For is one secure in his religion like one who risks it?' Where is the reverence of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, while you see in his Mosque, and at his chamber, the raising of voices, clamor, and busying with gossip, as if the Sanctuary is not his Sanctuary, and as if Umar bin Al-Khattab did not intend to beat the two men from Ta'if for raising their voices. He would not beat them except for a violation, so be aware if you are in his Mosque, and be a good neighbor, and beware lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not. 8 - My throat before your throat, O Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: Allah Almighty says, commanding the believers regarding the right of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: {That you may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor/support him (Tu'azziruhu) and revere him}. Sheikh al-Islam says: 'Al-Ta'zeer is a comprehensive name for helping him, supporting him, and protecting him from everything that harms him (1).' The Lord has judged with success for those who support him and honor him after describing him with faith, saying: {So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful} [Al-A'raf: 157]. Among the greatest proofs of love and reverence is supporting the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. He Almighty says: {For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allah and [His] approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger. Those are the truthful} [Al-Hashr: 8]. So the truthful one in his claim of love is the one who proves it by sacrificing his money, his family, and his self...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...and for the support of Allah and His Messenger. The Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, wrote the most wonderful examples and the most truthful deeds in defending the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and ransoming him with money, children, and self, in ease and hardship, difficulty and prosperity. The books of Seerah are full of mentioning their news. Sufficient for me from the necklace is what surrounds the neck, and from the bracelet what surrounds the wrist. Here are some of the masterpieces of their biographies... - Abu Bakr weeping on the day of Hijrah when Suraqah bin Malik caught up with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and Abu Bakr. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, asked him: 'Why do you weep?' He said: 'By Allah, I do not weep for myself, but I weep for you.' So the Messenger of Allah prayed against Suraqah saying: 'O Allah, suffice us against him however You will.' So the legs of his horse sank into the solid earth up to its belly (1). Indeed, Abu Bakr used to move to the right, left, behind, and in front of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, wondered at his action and asked him about it. He said, may Allah be pleased with him: 'O Messenger of Allah, I remember the pursuit so I walk behind you, and I remember the ambush so I am in front of you, and sometimes on your right, and sometimes on your left; I do not feel safe for you.' The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: 'O Abu Bakr, if there was something [harmful], would you love for it to be you instead of me?' He said: 'Yes, by the One who sent you with the truth' (2).
foot_note:
1. Narrated by Ahmad in Al-Musnad (1/155) 3, and Sheikh Ahmad Shakir authenticated its chain.
2. Al-Bidaya wa Al-Nihaya (3/180).

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, reached the cave and wanted to enter it, Al-Siddiq said to him: 'Stay where you are until I clear/check it for you. If there is any harm in it, let it befall me before you.' So he entered and felt around the cave but found nothing. The Messenger of Allah entered, exhausted and tired to his limit. As soon as they entered, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, rested his head on Abu Bakr's foot and slept. Al-Siddiq used to tear pieces from his garment and plug any hole, fearing that there might be some vermin in it that would harm the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. One hole remained, so he placed his heel over it. There was a snake in it which bit him. His place relative to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, prevented him from moving, but the pain became severe, and his tears flowed down and fell onto the face of the Messenger of Allah, waking him. He said: 'What is the matter, O Abu Bakr?' He said: 'I have been stung.' The Messenger spat lightly (Nafatha) on it, and it was healed by the permission of Allah (1)... Talha bin Ubaidullah fought the fight of eleven men who were around the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and were killed in the path of Allah, until his hand was struck and his fingers were cut off. He said 'Hass' (ouch) (2). The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Had you said Bismillah (In the name of Allah), the angels would have raised you while the people looked on' (3). What a people! Those people, eleven men, all ransoming his Beloved, peace and blessings be upon him...
foot_note:
1. Sharh Al-Mawahib Al-Laduniyyah (1/404).
2. Hass: With Kasra on Sin and Shaddah, a word a person says when feeling pain. Al-Nihayah (1/385).
3. Narrated by Al-Nasa'i, and Al-Albani classified it as Hasan, Sahih Sunan Al-Nasa'i (2/661) 2951.

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...with himself, and the twelfth remains, Talha bin Ubaidullah, fighting the fight of the eleven, and his hand becomes paralyzed due to how much he shielded the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, with it. Al-Bukhari narrated (1) from Qais who said: 'I saw Talha's hand paralyzed; he protected the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, with it on the Day of Uhud.' Indeed, on that day he, may Allah be pleased with him, sustained more than seventy stabs, shots, and strikes. Therefore, Abu Bakr said about him: 'That entire day belongs to Talha' (2)... Here is Abu Talha shielding the Messenger of Allah with his own self on the Day of Uhud. Anas says: 'When it was the Day of Uhud, people fled from the Prophet, while Abu Talha was before the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, shielding him with a shield (Juhfa).' A man would pass with a quiver of arrows, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, would say to him: 'Scatter them for Abu Talha.' The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, would look out to see the people, and Abu Talha would say: 'O Prophet of Allah, may my father and mother be sacrificed for you, do not look out, lest an arrow from the arrows of the people hit you. My throat/chest before your throat/chest' (4). And 'My throat before your throat' is either a statement about himself, may Allah be pleased with him, meaning: I stand before you such that if an arrow comes, it hits my throat and not yours. Or he intended supplication, meaning: May Allah make my throat closer to the arrows than yours...

2. Minhat Al-Ma'bud (2/99) 4410.
3. Mujawwib: Shielding him to protect him from the weapons of the disbelievers, Sharh Al-Nawawi (12/189).
4. Al-Bukhari (7/361)..., Muslim (3/1443) 1811.

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...so that I am hit instead of you (1)... How beautiful is what Anas bin Al-Nadr said on the Day of Uhud when the Muslims were exposed: 'O Allah, I apologize to You for what these—meaning his companions—have done, and I dissociate myself to You from what these—meaning the polytheists—have done.' Then he advanced and Sa'd met him. He said: 'O Sa'd bin Mu'adh, Paradise, by the Lord of Al-Nadr! I find its scent from the direction of Uhud.' Sa'd said: 'I could not do what he did, O Messenger of Allah.' Anas bin Malik said: 'We found in him some eighty odd strikes by sword, or stabs by spear, or shots by arrow. We found him killed, and the polytheists had mutilated him, so no one recognized him except his sister by his fingertips (2)...' Umm Amarah, Nusaybah bint Ka'b, had a witnessed stance on the Day of Uhud, such that the Messenger of Allah said about her: 'I did not turn right or left except that I saw her fighting before me.' She stood in the face of Ibn Qami'ah when he came looking for the Messenger of Allah saying: 'May I not survive if he survives,' until he struck her a blow on her shoulder, causing a hollow wound with depth. This wound remained for the Ummah as the role of woman in supporting the Messenger of Allah and defending him... Here is Sheikh al-Islam authoring a book named 'Al-Sarim Al-Maslul' (The Drawn Sword) to confront...
