book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...insults against the Messenger and to support the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and defend his Sharia... Do not think that support is limited to humans; rather, animals had a great role in defending him, peace and blessings be upon him. The arm/shoulder [of the sheep] that the Jewish woman presented as hospitality to him, peace and blessings be upon him, informed him. When the Messenger of Allah ate, and the people ate, he said to them: 'Lift your hands, for it has informed me that it is poisoned' (1). Indeed, a sheep slaughtered without the permission of its owners was stingy with the Messenger of Allah eating from suspicious meat. Abu Dawood narrated from a man of the Ansar that a woman invited the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so he came, and food was brought. He placed his hand, then the people placed [theirs] and ate. Our fathers looked at the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, chewing a morsel in his mouth. Then he said: 'I find the meat of a sheep taken without the permission of its owners.' The woman sent [a message], saying: 'O Messenger of Allah, I sent to Al-Baqi' (market) to buy a sheep for me but did not find any. So I sent to a neighbor of mine who had bought a sheep, that he send it to me for its price, but he was not found. So I sent to his wife, and she sent it to me.' The Messenger of Allah said: 'Feed it to the prisoners' (2). In the report of the sheep is a lesson for those who take heed?!!!
foot_note:
1. Narrated by Abu Dawood, and Al-Albani said: Hasan Sahih, Sahih Sunan Abi Dawood (4/174) 4512 and its origin is in the Two Sahihs.
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood, and Al-Albani authenticated it, Sahih Sunan Abi Dawood (3/244) 3333.

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: There remains a message that must—may Allah preserve you—reach you, which is that Allah is the Supporter of His Prophet inevitably, because His saying Almighty is Truth: {If you do not aid him, Allah has already aided him} [Al-Tawbah: 40] and He says {Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers} [Al-Hijr: 95]. No one plotted against the Messenger of Allah except that he was punished with the worst punishment. The biographies are overflowing with the news of Allah's sufficiency for His Messenger; but it is a test from Allah to know who supports Him and His Messengers in the unseen. Reality proves to you the division of people regarding this test into truthful in his love or otherwise... Here are examples I mention to you to comfort your soul, and to reassure your mind of the nearness of Allah's victory for His Prophet and the abundance of reward for you in the truthfulness of your intention and the greatness of your jealousy. Al-Bukhari (1) narrated from the hadith of Anas who said: There was a Christian man who embraced Islam and read Al-Baqarah and Al-Imran, and he used to write for the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. Then he returned to being a Christian. In Muslim: 'He went off fleeing until he joined the People of the Book, and they raised/honored him.' He used to say: 'Muhammad knows nothing but what I wrote for him.' In Muslim: 'They said: This one used to write for Muhammad, so they were impressed by him.' Allah caused him to die, and they buried him. In the morning, the earth had cast him out. They said: 'This is the deed of Muhammad and his companions; when he fled from them, they dug up our companion and threw him [out].' So they dug for him and dug deep. In the morning, the earth had cast him out. They said: 'This is the deed of Muhammad and his companions; when he fled from them, they dug up our companion and threw him [out].' So they dug for him and dug as deep as they could in the earth. In the morning, the earth had cast him out. So they knew it was not from people, and they left him cast out.' Sheikh al-Islam says: 'So this accursed one who fabricated against the Prophet that he...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...did not know except what was written for him, Allah broke him and exposed him by expelling him from his grave after being buried multiple times. This is a matter outside the norm (supernatural), indicating that this is a punishment for what he said and that he was a liar, since the generality of the dead does not suffer the like of this. And that this crime is greater than apostasy, since the generality of apostates die and do not suffer the like of this. And that Allah takes vengeance for His Messenger from those who attack him and insult him, and exposes the liar if people are unable to establish the Hadd (punishment) upon him' (1). Qadi Iyad (2) mentioned a strange story about a mocker of the Prophet. The jurists of Kairouan and the companions of Sahnun issued a fatwa to kill Ibrahim al-Fazari. He was a poet skilled in many sciences, and he used to mock Allah, His Prophets, and our Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. Judge Yahya bin Umar ordered him to be killed and crucified. He was stabbed with a knife and crucified upside down, then taken down. Some historians narrated that when his wood was raised and hands left it, it turned around and shifted him away from the Qibla. It was a sign for everyone, and the people said Takbir (Allahu Akbar). A dog came and licked his blood.' Indeed, Allah grants victory to His allies over His enemies if the enemies attack our Beloved. Sheikh al-Islam says in 'Al-Sarim Al-Maslul' (3) after mentioning experiences regarding what happens after insulting the Messenger of Allah: 'Similar to this is what...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...numbers of trustworthy Muslims, people of jurisprudence and expertise, told us about what they experienced many times in besieging fortresses and cities on the Levantine coasts when the Romans (Banu al-Asfar) were besieged there in our time. They said: We would besiege the fortress or city for a month or more than a month while it remained impregnable to us, until we almost despaired of it. Then, when its people resorted to insulting the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and attacking his honor, its conquest would hasten and become easy for us. It would hardly delay a day or two or thereabouts, then the place would be opened by force, and a great slaughter would occur among them. They said: We used to rejoice at the hastening of the conquest when we heard them attacking him, despite the hearts being filled with rage at what they said about him.' After what has been presented, I remind you of the obligation of supporting His Prophet; otherwise, if you do not support him, Allah will support him. Your support for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, is either Repelling (Daf') or Raising/Promoting (Raf'). The first is by teaching people his Sunnah, introducing them to him, and calling them to believe in his message. The second is by defending his noble person, peace and blessings be upon him, and his sayings by distinguishing their authentic from their weak, and refuting the doubts of the falsifiers regarding them. As some ignorant Muslims do by mocking what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, brought from his Lord of established matters like the Hijab, the beard, raising the Izar (lower garment) above the ankles, and the command to ally with whoever allies with Allah and His Messenger, and oppose whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text: ...Mocking the authentic, established Sunnah is Kufr (disbelief) that expels one from the religion (1). Allah Almighty said: {And if you asked them, they would surely say, "We were only conversing and playing." Say, "Is it Allah and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?" (65) Make no excuse; you have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals} [Al-Tawbah]. Know—may Allah grant you success—that negligence in defending the Messenger of Allah and his Sharia is a form of abandonment indicating weak faith, or its total disappearance. Whoever claims love but signs of jealousy for his sanctity, honor, and Sunnah do not appear on him is a liar in his claim; for if he were truthful, he would have triumphed/supported. Muhammad bin Al-Murtada said: 'The defender of the Sunnah, the protector of its sanctuary, is like the Mujahid in the path of Allah, preparing for Jihad whatever he can of equipment and strength, as He Glory be to Him said {And prepare against them whatever you are able of power}. It is established in the Sahih that Jibril was with Hassan bin Thabit supporting him as long as he defended the Messenger of Allah in his poetry. Likewise is whoever defends his religion and Sunnah after him out of faith in him, love, and sincerity towards him' (2)...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
At the end of the journey, I will advise you with recommendations that will make you, by Allah's permission, effective in serving the religion of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, and a supporter of the one whom your Lord commanded you to support:
1. Read the Tafsir of Surah Al-Hujurat and the end of Surah Al-Nur, for they contain great etiquette in dealing with the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, and his Sunnah.
2. Resolve to read a book in Prophetic Hadith and another in Prophetic Seerah to know the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, with true knowledge, and what relates to his conditions, days, Sunan, and guidance. I have mentioned to you previously some useful books in this field.
3. Distribute roles among your family members and your students in your school so that each one of them writes an authentic Hadith from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, every day in a prominent place where a board and pens are allocated for recording the Prophetic Sunnah. In the classroom, the Hadith is written on the side of the board. I have lived this experience with my colleagues, and we found the blessing of its application. No wonder, for serving the Sunnah is an honor.
4. Let each of us be keen to prepare a lesson in Prophetic Hadith, or the character of the Messenger of Allah, or Seerah, to deliver to his family members, his class students, or his mosque congregation, provided he relies in preparation on books concerned with the authentic Sunnah, filling people's times with the sayings of Allah and the Messenger of Allah...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
...peace and blessings be upon him, when others are busy with the sayings of humans and their worldly conditions.
5. Be keen on writing authentic Prophetic Hadiths, especially the non-famous ones, and publish them via SMS or email.
6. Do not hasten to publish a message that comes to you containing a Hadith from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, unless you verify the authenticity of the Hadith.
7. Hold a competition in memorizing the Prophetic Sunnah, or set questions around a book in Seerah, and set valuable prizes for the winner.
8. Bend your knees in the circles of knowledge, especially circles concerned with explaining Hadiths or courses held on Mustalah al-Hadith (Terminology) or Takhrij (Authentication).
9. Do not let your tongue slacken from constant prayer and peace upon him. Rather, be a key to good and always remind those around you of the virtue of praying upon him. Do not forget to acquire the book 'Jala' al-Afham fi al-Salah wa al-Salam ala Khair al-Anam' by Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyyah to read it and have it read.
10. Be keen to issue a periodical. If your soul desires more, then a magazine specialized in Hadiths from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, his conditions, guidance, and sayings, publishing therein what is authentic. If you cannot find a way to that, then publish in magazines, newspapers, and websites what your pen has written and what your ink has been honored with by taking a share in serving his Sunnah, and remember 'Convey from me even if it is a verse.'

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
11. Translate what you read and publish into a reality you live and apply. Spread his character and the sayings of the Messenger of Allah by your action before your speech; for education by example is a demand above all demands.
12. If you are a graduate student in a university, or a student of Hadith, devote yourself to collecting the guidance of the Messenger of Allah in every path: his guidance with his companions, his guidance with his enemies, his guidance in his dialogue, his guidance in his prayer. Busy yourself with collecting authentic Hadiths, extracting their benefits, and deriving from them, then publish what you wrote so its benefit spreads.
13. Let us think together about establishing a global channel translated into several languages to introduce the Messenger of Islam, peace and blessings be upon him, in which the scholar and the technician participate to serve the religion of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
14. Creating a website on the electronic network to introduce the Messenger of Allah and present his bright biography without deception or distortion.
15. Tracking the doubts of Orientalists (Mustashriqin) and the pollutions of Rationalists to refute them and expose their defects, especially at a time when criminals have tilted the basket full of vices with all force, audacity, and impulsiveness. You are amazed when you see among their effects someone bearing an Islamic name, but if you look at the content, you find it dripping with thought that none bears except a westernized (Mustaghrib) follower whose heart has absorbed desire and foreign ways. As for the formulation, strengthen...

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
...your heart against the striking of generated words, weak structures, and obscene grammatical errors, and hunting for journalistic phrases scavenged from here and there on the path of 'cut and paste'—the method of the incapable whose abilities crippled them from writing a book, yet they harmed those who possess Sharia knowledge, the Arabic tongue, or rhetorical taste.
16. Carrying out blessed campaigns to serve the Prophetic Sunnah accompanied by seminars and lectures, distributing books and audio recordings in their wake. The students of the College of Education, Arts Departments in Riyadh, had mentioned and famous campaigns that had good echoes and blessed effects.
17. Supporting the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when some people attack his Sunnah or belittle it, and arguing with them in the way that is best. Let not the people of falsehood be bolder in their falsehood than you are in clarifying your truth. Beware of blameworthy passivity and stop the hand of the one who wants to sink the ship.
18. Return to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah in all your affairs. Be pleased with his Sharia and submit to his judgment, and find no discomfort in yourself from what he, peace and blessings be upon him, decreed.
19. Start with the Book and Sunnah to reform yourself, your house, and those around you. Start with the Book and Sunnah to draw a happy path full of what Allah loves and His pleasure...

book_title: How to Support Your Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him)
publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
...Start with the Book and Sunnah to correct a crooked path Satan wanted you to tread, but your soul refused except to return to what your Lord loves, sealing it for you with Paradise. Start with the Book and Sunnah to solve problems that kept you awake with your wife, son, friend, or enemy. Start with the Book and Sunnah to know your past, what is obligatory upon you in your present, and what the world will face in the future. Live your most beautiful hours with the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah. Sit with the Companions and the Tabi'in and look into their books and traces.
'We have companions whose conversation we do not tire of... Intelligent, trustworthy in absence and presence.
They benefit us from their knowledge, knowledge of the past... And wisdom, discipline, and supported opinion.'
And always exemplify in your love the saying of the first:
'And it is strange that I long for them... And ask with yearning about those I met while they are with me.
My eye seeks them while they are in its blackness (pupil)... And my heart complains of distance while they are between my ribs.'

publisher: Dar Al-Hadara for Publishing and Distribution
text:
Stick—may Allah guard you—to the Truth even if you are alone. There must be companionship even if the road is long and its highwaymen are many. I ask Allah to accept from me and you, and to protect our honors from His kindled Fire for our protection of His [Prophet's] noble honor. And to make it a cause that connects us to His causes, and a store we find 'The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present,' by which we attain His pleasure and abundant reward. And to single us out with the specialty of the group of our Prophet and his congregation, and to gather us in the First Vanguard (Ra'il al-Awwal) and the People of the Right Gate from the people of his intercession. And to choose us for the service of His Book and the Sunnah of His Prophet, and make us protectors of the religion, defending it. Indeed He is the Guardian of that and Capable of it. Sufficient for us is Allah, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs. And His prayers and peace be upon our Master, the Seal of Prophets, and upon his Family and Companions.
